feedback.Physical object: Included — Tangible material with defined shape and substance.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — Naturally grown by marine organisms.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Included — Formed by biological processes from coral polyps.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Immobile and stable in form after breakage.
feedback.Structural: Included — Provides physical support in marine environments.
feedback.Passive: Included — Does not act independently once broken off.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — Not designed or constructed with purpose.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — No active emission or transformation.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — Not a signaling or computational object.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Not a direct interface object.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Included — Originally part of a coral reef ecosystem.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — A fragment is not essential on its own.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — May carry metaphor, but not inherent to identity.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not encode or transmit meaning.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Formation is natural, not rule-executing.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Not capable of recursive reference.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Does not inherently change with time.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Classification exists, but does not define its being.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Not used to signify identity.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Laws may govern collection, but not object essence.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Included — Commonly studied in ecology and marine science.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Function and meaning remain stable.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Recognized globally, especially in environmental contexts.
